summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Random Chat (Omegle-like) application. Backend APIs working correctly (85.7% success rate), frontend UI elements functional, but WebRTC/WebSocket integration has critical issues preventing video chat functionality.

critical_bugs.issue: WebSocket signaling server not responding to messages properly
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents user matching and peer-to-peer connections

integration_issues.issue: NotFoundError: Requested device not found - WebRTC initialization fails
Status badges not appearing due to WebRTC initialization failure

design_issues.issue: Using Manrope font (good choice for modern design)
Proper dark theme with rgb(9, 9, 11) background implemented correctly

passed_tests: Landing page loads with hero section and features
Settings modal opens and manages interests
Chat UI elements present and properly disabled when not connected
Video control buttons present and functional
Dark theme and emerald green accent design implemented
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix WebRTC initialization and WebSocket signaling server. The core video chat functionality is broken due to: 1) WebSocket connections not receiving/processing messages properly, 2) Media device access failing (may need fallback handling), 3) Status indicators not updating due to connection failures. All UI elements are properly implemented but the real-time communication layer needs debugging.
